wikipedia_page.main: Thomasina Jean "Tommi" Miers, OBE (born February 1976) is an English cook, writer and television presenter. She is the co-founder of the Wahaca chain of Mexican street food restaurants.

response: It is now home to a number of noteworthy residents including musicians Paloma Faith and Rita Ora, chef Thomasina Miers, film director, DJs and musicians Don Letts and Mark Rae, actress Thandie Newton, singer Lily Allen, model-turned-author Sophie Dahl, author Zadie Smith, David Cameron's ex-strategy guru Steve Hilton, the actor and writer Phoebe Waller-Bridge and Sienna Miller.
|University of Edinburgh (Catherine Slessor, Thomasina Miers, Miles Jupp, Phil Swanson)
* Soup Kitchen, with Thomasina Miers and Annabel Buckingham (2005)
* Little Book of Soup with Thomasina Miers, Annabel Buckingham (2006)
* Thomasina Miers – Chef and founder of Wahaca restaurant chain
*Thomasina Miers (born 1976), English cook, writer and television presenter
*1 April – Thomasina Miers wins the 2005 series of MasterChef Goes Large.
Wahaca (phonetic spelling of the Mexican State of Oaxaca) is a UK restaurant group selling Mexican-style street food, co-founded by Thomasina Miers, with 13 branches in the United Kingdom.
Wahaca has won awards for its food, design, and sustainability. In 2016, co-founders Mark Selby and Thomasina Miers were voted restaurateurs of the year by Caterer Magazine.

The 2021 series was won by the University of Edinburgh whose team of Catherine Slessor, Thomasina Miers, Miles Jupp and Phil Swanson beat Hertford College, Oxford and their team of Soweto Kinch, Elizabeth Norton, Adam Fleming and Isabelle Westbury.
*Thomasina Miers (born 1976), cook, writer, restaurateur, television presenter

link_mentions.page: Off Menu with Ed Gamble and James Acaster

response: The winning University of Edinburgh team consisted of Catherine Slessor, Thomasina Miers, Miles Jupp and Phil Swanson. The second placed Hertford College team consisted of Soweto Kinch, Elizabeth Norton, Adam Fleming and Isabelle Westbury.
